glossary.definition: An equation is a statement that expresses the idea that two mathematical {expressions} are equal.
An equation is a statement that expresses the idea that two mathematical {expressions} are equal.
In this class, you can think of an expression as something like a number, {sum} of numbers, {product} of numbers, et cetera. It could also involve {variables} whose values are unknown.
A sum is the result of adding numbers.
A product is the result of multiplying numbers.
A variable is a symbol that represents a number.
